Technique Names: Walking Stance (Gunnun Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Shoulder width apart, front foot forward, weight evenly distributed, upright posture
Common Issues: Stance too wide/narrow, leaning, uneven weight distribution

Technique Names: Low Block (Najunde Bakat Palmok Makgi), Middle Block (Kaunde Bakat Palmok Makgi)
Key Points Summary: Low block at belt level, middle block at solar plexus, opposite hand to hip, strong chambering
Common Issues: Block height errors, bent arms, poor coordination with stepping

Technique Names: Straight Punch (Baro Jirugi)
Key Points Summary: Punch at solar plexus level, rotate fist on impact, full extension, opposite hand to hip
Common Issues: Punch height errors, incomplete rotation, overextension

Technique Names: Attention Stance Extended (Charyeot Sogi), Ready Stance Extended (Junbi Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Perfect posture alignment, consistent foot positioning, even weight distribution, alert readiness
Common Issues: Improper foot spacing, slouching, looking down, tense shoulders

Technique Names: Low Block Extended, Middle Block Extended
Key Points Summary: Enhanced form and power, hip rotation for power, strong downward/circular motion
Common Issues: Insufficient force, no hip involvement, poor timing with footwork

Technique Names: Straight Punch Extended
Key Points Summary: Two top knuckles, straight line to target, hip rotation for power, fist rotation
Common Issues: Wrong knuckles, curved path, no rotation, telegraphing

Technique Names: Walking Stance Basic, Sitting Stance Basic (Annun Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Smooth transitions, proper stance dimensions, sitting stance with thighs parallel
Common Issues: Incorrect distances/angles, insufficient sitting depth, poor balance

Technique Names: High-Middle Block Combination, Low-Middle Block Combination
Key Points Summary: Clear level distinction, smooth transitions, equal power in both blocks
Common Issues: Rushing between blocks, inconsistent levels, weak second technique

Technique Names: Double Punch (Dubeon Jireugi)
Key Points Summary: First punch sets up second, quick retraction, maintain momentum, equal power
Common Issues: Slow between punches, weak first punch, balance loss

Technique Names: Walking Stance Advanced, L-Stance Basic (Niunja Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Perfect stance dimensions, smooth weight transfers, 70/30 weight distribution in L-stance
Common Issues: Varying stance width, choppy transitions, equal weight in L-stance

Technique Names: High Block Refined, Knife Hand Block Basic (Sonkal Makgi)
Key Points Summary: Maximum power with hip rotation, knife hand in L-stance only, arc motion from opposite shoulder
Common Issues: Block too low, no hip involvement, wrong stance for knife hand

Technique Names: Reverse Punch (Bandae Jireugi), Knife Hand Strike (Sonkal Taerigi)
Key Points Summary: Rear hand punch with maximum hip rotation, knife hand chopping motion to neck level
Common Issues: Using front hand instead of rear, poor hip engagement, wrong target levels

Technique Names: Walking Stance Advanced, L-Stance
Key Points Summary: Consistent stance dimensions, proper weight distribution (70/30 in L-stance)
Common Issues: Varying stance width, equal weight distribution in L-stance

Technique Names: High Block, Inner Forearm Block (An Palmok Makgi)
Key Points Summary: High block above forehead, inner forearm blocks across body with elbow close to ribs
Common Issues: Block too low for head protection, elbow moving away from body

Technique Names: Front Snap Kick (Ap Cha Busigi)
Key Points Summary: Knee up first, snap with ball of foot, quick return to chamber, maintain balance
Common Issues: Pushing instead of snapping, poor balance, not chambering properly

Technique Names: Walking Stance Power, L-Stance Advanced
Key Points Summary: Explosive stepping with control, precise 70/30 weight distribution, quick stance establishment
Common Issues: Loss of precision with speed, poor landing control, incorrect weight distribution

Technique Names: Twin Forearm Block Basic (Sang Palmok Makgi), Knife Hand Block Advanced
Key Points Summary: Both forearms simultaneously, parallel arms, maximum arc motion with snapping finish
Common Issues: One arm weaker, arms not parallel, reduced arc motion

Technique Names: Back Fist Strike Basic (Dung Joomuk Taerigi), Elbow Strike Basic (Palkup Taerigi)
Key Points Summary: Whipping motion from elbow, hip rotation for elbow power, back of fist contact
Common Issues: Wrong fist part, insufficient whipping, poor hip involvement

Technique Names: Front Snap Kick Advanced
Key Points Summary: High knee chamber, snap with ball of foot, quick return to chamber, perfect balance
Common Issues: Low chamber, pushing instead of snapping, poor balance

Technique Names: Fixed Stance (Gojung Sogi), Sitting Stance (Annun Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Feet shoulder width apart for fixed stance, thighs parallel to ground for sitting stance
Common Issues: Feet too close in fixed stance, not sitting low enough

Technique Names: Twin Forearm Block, Knife Hand Block
Key Points Summary: Both forearms simultaneously and parallel, knife hand in L-stance with arc motion
Common Issues: One arm higher than other, wrong stance for knife hand block

Technique Names: Back Fist Strike, Side Elbow Thrust (Yop Palkup Tulgi)
Key Points Summary: Back of fist whipping motion, elbow travels horizontally with hip rotation
Common Issues: Wrong fist part, elbow traveling up/down instead of horizontally

Technique Names: Walking Stance Expert, Bending Ready Stance (Guburyo Junbi Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Flawless dimensions and explosive control, significant knee bend with weight on balls of feet
Common Issues: Any deviation from perfect form, insufficient knee bend, weight on heels

Technique Names: Rising Block (Chookyo Makgi), X-Block (Gyocha Makgi)
Key Points Summary: Strong upward rising motion above head level, both arms crossing simultaneously with equal power
Common Issues: Insufficient upward motion, unequal arm power in X-block

Technique Names: Upset Punch (Dwijibeo Jireugi), Side Elbow Thrust Advanced
Key Points Summary: Punch travels upward to chin/solar plexus, maximum hip rotation for elbow
Common Issues: Horizontal instead of upward punch, insufficient hip involvement

Technique Names: Side Piercing Kick (Yop Cha Jirugi), Turning Kick Basic (Dollyo Chagi)
Key Points Summary: High side chamber with knife foot edge, hip rotation drives circular motion
Common Issues: Low chamber position, wrong contact surface, linear instead of circular motion

Technique Names: Close Ready Stance (Moa Junbi Sogi), X-Stance (Gyocha Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Feet close and parallel, legs cross at knee level with weight on front leg
Common Issues: Feet not parallel, crossing too high/low, poor weight distribution

Technique Names: Palm Block (Sonbadak Makgi), Twin Forearm Block Advanced
Key Points Summary: Block with palm surface in circular motion, perfect simultaneous action with maximum power
Common Issues: Wrong hand surface, poor circular motion, slight timing differences

Technique Names: Ridge Hand Strike (Sonnal Deung Taerigi), Arc Hand Strike (Bandalson Taerigi)
Key Points Summary: Ridge of hand circular motion to temple/neck, fingertips in arc motion to face/throat
Common Issues: Wrong hand surface, poor circular technique, incorrect finger formation

Technique Names: Side Piercing Kick Advanced, Back Piercing Kick (Dwit Cha Jirugi)
Key Points Summary: Perfect chamber with maximum thrust, complete 180Â° turn with bottom of foot contact
Common Issues: Any chamber imperfection, incomplete turn, not looking at target

Technique Names: Warrior Ready Stance (Mu Ja Junbi Sogi), Crane Stance (Haktari Sogi)
Key Points Summary: Flawless technical execution with warrior presence, perfect balance on one leg
Common Issues: Any technical imperfection, lack of warrior presence, touching ground with raised foot

Technique Names: Circular Block (Dollimyo Makgi), Pressing Block (Noollo Makgi)
Key Points Summary: Perfect circular motion with maximum coverage, strong downward pressure with both hands
Common Issues: Broken circular motion, insufficient downward pressure, poor hand coordination

Technique Names: Spear Finger Thrust (Pyeonsonkkeut Tulgi), Twin Vertical Punch (Sang Sewo Jireugi)
Key Points Summary: Thrust with fingertips for maximum penetration, both fists simultaneously with perfect synchronization
Common Issues: Bent finger positioning, timing differences between punches, incorrect fist orientation

Technique Names: Reverse Turning Kick (Bandae Dollyo Chagi), Jump Front Kick (Ttwimyo Ap Chagi)
Key Points Summary: Complete reverse motion with exceptional balance, jump and kick simultaneously with controlled landing
Common Issues: Incomplete reverse motion, poor jump-kick coordination, balance problems in air
